page.title: 02AMPNEY OF THE CROSS
page.content: A great deal of poor quality{Roman } pottery has been found in{Ampney {Crucis.}The village has 2 ancient crosses, one ( possibly{Norman}) found on what is now the cricket pitch and moved to the Church Walk; the other is 13th century. The Chester Masters were given the Norcot lands by{Elizabeth I. Mr Masters was her physician.{Ampney {Park} was built in the 16th century. In 1719, Robert Pleydell of Ampney Park left Â£80 per year to found a school for poor children. This was started in 1722 but no-one knows where. In 179, a new school opened in what is now the School House. In 1861, the present infant room was built on. In 1963, the modern block was added. In 1983, a woman was appointed as Head for the first time. Harnhill Mill was working until 5 years ago and Ampney Mill until 17 years ago.
